alert.note: Alert for McDuffie (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 5:12PM EDT until September 01 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Georgia, including the following areas, Columbia and McDuffie. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thomson, Thomson-McDuffie County Airport, Wrightsboro, Appling, Ansley Mill, White Oak Campground, University Hospital McDuffie, Carpenter Airport and Columbia County Jail. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 167 and 185. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
